reviews.review_msg: The prof seems nice, but the course structure is poor. Lecture material is not novel if you've taken Geog 251, 255, 355, etc., but exams have certain questions that require detailed memorization with no study guide/mention of specific memorization beforehand. Assignments graded 1-2 days before next assignment due, hard to implement feedback.

I enjoyed this course. It was very hands on and practical. In the end you get a project for your portfolio. If you follow all the instructions the prof gives there is no problem. Don't skip classes, you will fall behind. Thanks Suzana!

Very unclear with what she expects of students. Poorly designed course. Really hard marker. Reads off slides. Expects you to know things that you haven't learned. TA and her do not sync together. Learned everything on my own for dreamweaver. Learned NOTHING from this class. She is easy to approach, and seems nice. Grades suffered from this class!
Very practical and hands-on course. I developed some very useful GIS skills. Thanks for a super class Suzana!
Very nice course structure with good practical components. The teacher explains well and takes the time to go over materials.
Suzana is difficult to understand and can be quite rude. Lectures are boring and her voice will leave you wanting to wear earmuffs by the end of the semester. TA Anthony is very helpful.

The person below is too bright!! The Prof. teaching style is good and benefits the slow learners a lot, there were many in this class!! I learn many things from the lectures, and this Prof. is always willing to help and listen to students problems. Very organized course!!
Sometimes hard to understand, but she encourages questions and explains concepts well.
nice prof. but hard final exam
